multiple.question: Was the Miller-Urey experiment an example of a traditional lab or an inquiry-based lab?

answers.answer: Traditional because it was done in a laboratory setting
Traditional because the scientists followed a procedure
Inquiry because the scientists developed their own procedure and were not sure of the outcome
Inquiry because the scientists who carried out the experiment did not come up with the original hypothesis
The Miller-Urey experiment was both traditional and an inquiry.

multiple.question: Which of the following would be most similar to a scientist creating an experimental design?

answers.answer: A plumber fixing a leak in a kitchen sink
An architect drawing up a blueprint for a new house
A baker following a recipe to make a cake
A mechanic changing the oil in a car engine
An airplane pilot flying a plane across an ocean
